page.title: 17STATE SCHOOLS
page.content:
Stowmarket High School is situated on the outskirts of Stowmarket.At one time it was a Grammar School for children from 11 to 18,but in 1971 it was changed to an Upper School taking children from 13 to 18.It now has 870 pupils and 52 staff.The school takes pupils from 3 Middle Schools.Stowmarket Middle,Combs Middle and Needham Market Middle.The School day is from 09.00 to 15.55 with a lunch break of 1 hour. In the 3rd year pupils learn all subjects,but in the 4th year they opt for subjects which they enjoy and many take these at CSE and O level in their 5th year.
Oakwood School was opened in 1975 for malajusted boys.The 47 boys who board at the school come from all over Suffolk and are aged 7 and over.
